Title: FBA Webinars
Url: https://wiki.opensourceecology.org/wiki/FBA%20Webinars
----------------------------------------
'''Join the Future Builder Academy Webinar Series'''

As part of our Future Builder Academy, we’re hosting a series of live webinars exploring critical topics in open source economic development, including:
*Successes and failures of the open source movement - software and hardware
*Building experimental prototype communities of tomorrow
*Scalable collaboration techniques for transitioning to a collaboratively-literate world
*Creating paradise at scale
*The open, collaborative economy transition
*Achieving financial freedom and purpose, starting with materials means
*Moving from the surveillance state to an open source panopticon
*Solving the housing crisis
*Strengthening civic engagement and democracy
*Advancing open source manufacturing
*And much more

'''Our goal is to raise awareness about the path to a post-scarcity economy grounded in abundance thinking.'''  And to invite people 
*These webinars will provide timeless knowledge, mental models, and foundational insights to world-building in real life.
*Content is relevant to real-life agency - including the [[1000 Hour Curriculum]], and may feed into [[Radio Free World]] broadcasts .
*The intended audience is anyone wishing to increase their agency as a world builder
*Our broad program involves open sourcing 50 critical tools for building productive infrastructures of civilization (the [[Global Village Construction Set]]) by 2028 with a $50M budget to liberate approximately $11T of human primary and secondary production. This webinar feeds into this mission.
*The longer-term program is to open source source the entire technosphere, including more advanced areas such as space ships and microchips.

'''Webinar Format'''
*20 minutes of presentation
*30 minutes of live Q&A
*Weekly sessions, starting September 1, 2025
*Live global webinars occur at 1 PM or 3 PM CST USA time.
*Live USA webinars occur at 7 PM CST USA time.
*Full 2-month schedule to be released on September 1

'''How to Participate'''
*'''Watch for Free:''' Recorded sessions will be posted to the [[OSE YouTube Channel]] shortly after each webinar (unless the content is too sensitive for release). 
*'''Join Live:''' To attend live and ask questions, sign up by donating any amount that you believe the webinar will be worth to you:
